bug.author: wronk
bug.summary: kfctl 0.7.1 -- both linux and darwin versions are linux?
bug.description:
/kind bug I believe both versions (linux and darwin) of 0.7.1 release are actually linux Setting up a cluster using kfctl for v0.7.1 on mac (darwin version) results in an error: $ kfctl build -V -f ${CONFIG_URI} -bash <home_dir>/.kfctl/kfctl: cannot execute binary file What did you expect to happen: I expected kfctl to build the deployment files
MD5 sums are the same for both the and versions downloaded from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/tag/v0.7.1>here</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-code>~/Downloads$ md5 kfctl_v0.7.1-0-ga627f74_darwin.tar.gz MD5 (kfctl_v0.7.1-0-ga627f74_darwin.tar.gz) = eaa841bd0e38bb37f31cf3cc7e4c50a8 ~/Downloads$ md5 kfctl_v0.7.1-0-ga627f74_linux.tar.gz MD5 (kfctl_v0.7.1-0-ga627f74_linux.tar.gz) = eaa841bd0e38bb37f31cf3cc7e4c50a8 </denchmark-code>
Environment:
Kubeflow version: 0.7.1 kfctl version: (use kfctl version): 0.7.1 Kubernetes platform: GCP Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13+", GitVersion:"v1.13.11-dispatcher" OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): macOS 10.15 (Catalina)

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kfctl/issues/161>kubeflow/kfctl#161</denchmark-link> is the issue to fix the makefile. /assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/richardsliu>@richardsliu</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/richardsliu>@richardsliu</denchmark-link> : Closing this issue.
